title: Signing the Protocol of Agreement on Accession of the Republic of Uzbekistan to the World Trade Organization (WTO)
decision_details: - The Republic of Uzbekistan has been in the process of negotiating with other member countries to become a member of the World Trade Organization. The General Council of the WTO has established a Working Party to examine the application of Uzbekistan and submit to the General Council the relevant recommendations with a draft Protocol of Accession. Sri Lanka also has become a member of the relevant Working Party with the intention of exporting tea to Uzbekistan and the relevant officials in Sri Lanka have negotiated with the Uzbekistan officials in that regard and have reached the initial consensus on the lower binding tariffs for tea products anticipated to be exported to that country. Accordingly, Uzbekistan requires to sign the "Protocol of Agreement on Accession" with Sri Lanka being a member of Working Party, confirming that bilateral discussions were held as per the relevant provisions of the  World Trade Organization. The Proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to sign the said Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.
